meanings.definition: The study of punishment for crime.
meanings.sent1: In penology, experts analyze different ways to punish criminals.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a career in penology to understand crime and punishment better.
meanings.sent3: The professor's penology class was so interesting that even the sleepy students perked up.
meanings.sent4: The evolution of penology can be compared to the growth of a tree, with new branches of knowledge sprouting over time.
meanings.sent5: Through studying penology, one can gain insights into the complexities of criminal justice systems.

meanings.definition: The theory and practice of punishment and rehabilitation of criminals.
meanings.sent1: Penology involves not only punishment but also helping criminals reform.
meanings.sent2: The government invested in penology programs to reduce recidivism rates.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit about a penology-themed escape room had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to penology was like a skilled gardener, nurturing the growth of reformed individuals.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the harsh realities of penology in a way that left a lasting impact on viewers.
